meanings.definition: A deduction from the usual cost of something.
meanings.sent1: I got a discount on my new shoes, so they were cheaper than usual.
meanings.sent2: The store offered a discount on all winter coats.
meanings.sent3: My friend joked that he would only buy the car if he got a discount for being a good driver.
meanings.sent4: She always finds a way to get a discount, like a magician pulling a rabbit out of a hat.
meanings.sent5: The discount sign outside the store caught my eye immediately.

meanings.definition: To deduct an amount from the usual price.
meanings.sent1: I will discount the total amount by 10% for you.
meanings.sent2: The cashier discounted my purchase after I showed the coupon.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to discount the last question on the test because it was too difficult.
meanings.sent4: She had to discount the damaged items to make them sell faster.
meanings.sent5: He always tries to discount the price, like a negotiator in a movie.

meanings.definition: To disregard or minimize the importance of something.
meanings.sent1: You shouldn't discount the value of your hard work.
meanings.sent2: She tends to discount other people's opinions without considering them.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to discount the suspect's alibi due to conflicting evidence.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs will only lead you to discount the risks involved.
meanings.sent5: He tried to discount the criticism, but it still affected him deeply.
